main event: A big disc-shaped object was observed near Moscow, USSR in 1958. Radar detected the object descending in a spiral at a low altitude before it rose vertically.
interesting points: The sighting was reported to have occurred near Moscow, USSR at an altitude of 3,000 m.
Eyewitnesses described the object as a big disk with good stability and maneuverability.
The object was observed performing a spiral dive before taking off and disappearing into the sky.
The report suggests that this type of aircraft will be important for the future aircraft industry due to its vertical take-off capabilities.
The report indicates that flying object sightings from outside the USSR were seldom considered to be of interest.
result: the object was identified as a Soviet aircraft with a red wing.
witnesses: reported by eyewitnesses near Moscow, USSR
